title: Finite groups with coprime non-linear codegrees
authors: Ashkan Zarezadeh, Behrooz Khosravi, Zeinab Akhlaghi
abstract:
Given a finite group G with an irreducible character \chi \in Irr(G), the
codegree of \chi is defined by cod(\chi) = |G :\ker \chi|/\chi(1). The set of
non-linear irreducible character codegrees of G is denoted by cod(G|G'). In
this note, we classify all finite groups G with |cod(G|G')|> 1 and for each
pair of distinct elements m, n \in cod(G|G'), m and n are coprime.
